main event: An unidentified object appeared on ground radar for 13 seconds in Denver, Colorado on July 26, 1952. No further visual or photographic observation was made.
interesting points: The object appeared on ground radar for 13 seconds.
There was no visual or photographic observation of the object.

On August 12, 1956, several witnesses including Mrs. Mary Mettiner and Mrs. Jessie West reported seeing a large, luminous, circular object moving swiftly and silently through the sky near the Crenographic Memorial in Denver, Colorado.
The object had a flaming red center and bluish lights around the rim, hovered for a few seconds, and then sped off toward the west at tremendous speed.
Other observers, including Lt. Jim McKenney and Lt. Jones of the Air Force, reported seeing the same or a similar phenomenon around the same time.
sighted object: unidentified object on ground radar; large, luminous, circular object in the sky
witnesses: ground radar operators; Mrs. Mary Mettiner, Mrs. Jessie West, Lt. Jim McKenney, Lt. Jones
photographs: yes, the report mentions photographs were taken
